name: lp-parse-template
description: Launchpeer bare bones parse server with dashboard.

PARSE_SERVER_MOUNT.description: Configure Parse API route. usually its /parse but can be anything just include a /the-name.

PARSE_APP_ID.description: This value MUST match your heroku app name.

PARSE_MASTER_KEY.description: A key that overrides all permissions. Keep this secret.

PARSE_SERVER_URL.description: URL to connect to your Heroku instance (update with your app's name + PARSE_MOUNT)

PARSE_DASHBOARD_APP_NAME.description: replace 'yourappname' with the name you defined for your heroku deploy.

PARSE_ADMIN_DASHBOARD_USERNAME.description: Username for the parse dashboard.  Allows administrative access to your database.

PARSE_ADMIN_DASHBOARD_PASSWORD.description: Password for the admin account for your parse dashboard

PARSE_CLIENT_KEY.description: The key used to connect to your server by clients.

GCM_SENDER_ID.description: Sender ID assigned to you via Firebase Console.

APPLE_BUNDLE_ID.description: The bundle identifier used with your apple application example: com.myapp.ios

APNS_PASSPHRASE.description: When exporting .p12 files for push certificates, you can set a password on the file.  This is that password.

APNS_PUSH_PRODUCTION.description: Tells the server to use either sandbox push certs or production.  You should set to true if deploying to production.
